headline: Why Robinhood Stock Soared 151% in the First Half of 2025
summary: Robinhood soared alongside a boost in crypto prices, and as its profits jumped.  The company announced a new tokenization platform, allowing European investors to buy U.S. stocks through tokens.  Shares of Robinhood Markets (NASDAQ: HOOD) have soared this year as the stock has been one of the biggest under-the-radar winners on the market.

headline: Robinhood Has Just Unlocked a Huge Growth Opportunity
summary: It has begun offering tokenized shares of publicly traded companies to customers in Europe.  Robinhood Markets' (NASDAQ: HOOD) stock-trading and investing platform has grown in popularity with retail investors in recent years.  Tokenized shares: a risky move or a genius idea?

headline: CEO Tom Gardner: Skip Options Until You Know They're for Hedging, Not Gambling
summary: Trading options can be a useful, conservative strategy for experienced investors.  For those just starting out, Motley Fool CEO Tom Gardner says options are more like gambling -- and that's not a good strategy for anyone.  In fact, Motley Fool Chief Executive Officer Tom Gardner recently issued a stark warning about rookie investors who are interested in options.

raw.headline: CEO Tom Gardner: Skip Options Until You Know They're for Hedging, Not Gambling

headline: Why is Robinhood creating its own crypto blockchain?
summary: Robinhood is making a bold leap into the future of finance, launching tokenised US stocks across Europe, introducing crypto staking in the US, and building its own Layer 2 blockchain. In this episode of Yahoo Finance Future Focus, our host Brian McGleenon speaks with Robinhood crypto SVP and general manager Johann Kerbrat about how the company is fusing crypto innovation with traditional finance to build a faster, cheaper, and more accessible platform for the next generation of investors.

raw.headline: Why is Robinhood creating its own crypto blockchain?

headline: Robinhood doubles down on crypto with its own blockchain, 24/7 trading and tokenised stocks
summary: Financial services firm Robinhood is offering European users access to tokenised US stocks, while Americans can earn rewards by staking cryptocurrencies.

headline: Robinhood’s OpenAI Tokens Walk a Legal Tightrope, Says Crypto Lawyer
summary: Efforts to tokenize pre-IPO stocks, like what Robinhood is doing with OpenAI, may help unlock liquidity in private markets, but the structure likely qualifies as a security, carries bankruptcy risk and could spark lawsuits over shareholder agreement breaches.

raw.headline: Robinhood’s OpenAI Tokens Walk a Legal Tightrope, Says Crypto Lawyer
